fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating multiple scenarios, unless you're using a proper naming convention it is very easy to lose track of what the original scenario was and can easily lead to accidentally deleting the wrong one.

h3. Proposed solution

A system label should be added next to the original scenario which would serve as an identifier to avoid such accidental situations.

 !JPO3_Plan_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Original scenario identifier

fields.description:
* Setup:
 ** *Create a project* including *6 issues*:
 *** *1 epic*; and
 *** *5 stories*
 ** *Create a plan* using that project as issue source
 ** Make the following changes in your plan:
 *** Make all stories *children of the epic*
 *** *Assign the same person* to *the epic* and the *first three stories*
 *** Leave the two remaining stories *unassigned*
 *** Make sure that the plan is *not grouped by any field*
 * (Once your plan is setup), follow these reproduction steps:
 ** *Expand all issues* in the plan using the *Issue > Expand all* button
 ** *Collapse the epic*
 ** Click on *View setting > Group by Assignee*
 ** *Expand all issues* in the plan (again) using the *Issue > Expand all* button
 ** Drag *Story 2 and drop it before Story 1*

h4. Expected results

*Story 2* should now be displayed *+before+* *Story 1*.
h4. Actual results

*Story 2* is now displayed *+after+* *Story 3*.
  
 !drag-drop-issue-ends-in-weird-position.gif|width=771,height=542!
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping an issue in a plan sometimes results in the issue ending up in an unexpected place

fields.description: It would be great if we could sum up the story points of all issues linked to an Epic. Currently we are only able to sum-up the subtasks.
fields.summary: Sum up story points of all issues linked to an Epic

fields.description: It would be nice to have the possibility to change what appears on cards in the board layout in Next Gen project, ie. show/hide labels.
fields.summary: Next Gen project - Ability to change card layout in board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Selecting "Hide Menu" at any Agile Report in JSW Classic Projects hide the Report Name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Start in a Kanban or Scrum project in Jira.
2) Click "Reports" in the left navbar.
3) Select a report from the "Agile" category.
5) In the (topmost) 3-dots menu on the right, select "Hide menus" (or press 'z').
6) Note that the report title disappears, but no vertical height change occurs.

h3. Expected Results
The report name should still be visible

h3. Actual Results
the report title disappears
 !image-2020-08-03-16-05-59-947.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-08-03-16-06-17-463.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Selecting "Hide Menu" at any Agile Report in JSW Classic Projects hide the Report Name
Classic scrum board do not set the right component when we switch from Board A to Board B

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Refresh issue on Sprint filter when running concurrent sprints

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a classic software project
# create multiple issues
# create multiple sprints under the same board
# access via URL https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=<boardnumber>&sprint=<sprintnumber>

h3. Expected Results
As we are accessing the specific sprint - it should only show the issues under this sprint

h3. Actual Results
It shows issues under *All sprints*

h3. Workaround
Go to another sprint and then back to your required sprint. This will refresh the results and show the correct issues under the relevant sprint
fields.summary: issue on Sprint filter when running concurrent sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With a new plan created changes to labels via ARJ are not properly reflected in the changes popup.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # No ways to repro an issue locally were found. Customer has one test plan with 20k issues they use to learn and test ARJ. Please check the recorded support video call with the customer
 # Requested access to the customer's ARJ plan (see GSAC issue)

h3. Expected Results

Changes made to labels are expected to be visible on Review Changes popup of ARJ and, when committed, should be saved on affected Jira issues.
h3. Actual Results

Even counter shows increasing amount of changes, once clicked Review Pending Changes popup is empty and no changes may be saved.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Review changes in a plan disappeared without commits in Jira

fields.description:
Related To JSWCLOUD-17447
I’d like to be able to delete/edit a worklog entry
fields.summary: Ability to delete worklog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Open Pull Requests not showing as a Warning on Releases.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add tickets to a Version.
 # On Bitbucket, create a pull request.
 # Let this pull request open.

h3. Expected Results

Even if the ticket is closed, if the pull request is opened, it will show a Warning on Releases' page as mentioned on the documentation:

https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/use-the-release-page-to-check-the-progress-of-a-version/
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't show warnings about Pull requests.

!Screen Shot 2020-07-31 at 12.51.46.png|width=503,height=160!

!Screen Shot 2020-07-31 at 12.52.15.png|width=169,height=135!

!Screen Shot 2020-07-31 at 14.13.01.png|width=476,height=253!
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Open Pull Requests not showing as "Warning" on Releases

fields.description: The sub-tasks which status A should respect the parent issue status if the parent issue is in the Backlog with a status B, without the need to have a status B as well.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like Subtask status to be reflected in Parent status if the parent is not displayed in the Board

fields.description: It would be great if we have API for integration between Freshdesk and Jira.
fields.summary: API for integration between Freshdesk and Jira

fields.description: When having a shortcut link on the left side of the project panel, that repository should be the default one for the "Create branch" button on the Development panel.
fields.summary: "Create branch" button should automatically choose the Jira-linked (shortcut) repository in Bitbucket.

fields.description: It would be good if we have a scheduled clearance of the done column with A4J
fields.summary: Automatically clear done column and not delete the issues

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

When using the API GET /rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}, it should show the type of board of the project. For Classic projects, it shows correctly, but for next-gen it only shows only "Simple".
h3. *Suggestion:*

Show if the board is Kanban or Scrum via API for next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Show if a board of a next-gen project is either Scrum or Kanban via API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Even though it's possible to set absences for members of shared teams, the Advanced Roadmaps auto-schedule doesn't take it into consideration when scheduling issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Advanced Roadmaps plan using a JSW classic board as the issue source
# Create a shared team in *Plans >  View shared teams*
# Add members to the team created above
# Click on the member's name and click on *+ Create absence*
# Define a period of absence, it can be a whole week
# Access the created plan and click on the *Teams* tab
# Delete all the existing teams and click *+ Create team*, then select *Add existing shared team* and select the shared team you've created
# Associate the team with the issue source
# Go back to the plan and click the "Auto-schedule" button


h3. Expected Results

The timeline shows a gap in the team's absence or it shows a longer period for the issues to be completed in the timeline

h3. Actual Results

The issues are schedule as there is no absence set.

h3. Workaround

Switch to the 2.0 interface and use the auto-scheduler there which does take into consideration leaves of absence.
fields.summary: The Advanced Roadmaps auto-schedule isn't considering team's absenses

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As an administrator, I would like to have an automated way to monitor the status of my DVCS integrations in case something fails. Currently, the only possible way to check this is by noticing possible information not being updated and manually accessing the DVCS page to check the errors.

An API would allow integrations with third-party monitoring tools.
fields.summary: Provide APIs to monitor DVCS integration statuses

fields.description:
Summary:

Most web browsers have a CTRL + Click command that will open the link you are clicking on in a new tab. That works properly on some links in JIRA, but not all.

 

*Repro:*

Create a Jira task.  Save.

In the comments, add a comment and paste in a link to another Jira task/bug/etc.

Jira does it's auto-parsing of the link and displays the task/bug/etc title and Jira #.  

Save comment.

Now navigate away, from that new Jira task.

Now come back to that Jira task.

 

*Bug:*

CTRL + Click on the link to the linked task/bug/etc with the intention to open it in a new tab. What actually happens is the current tab navigates away from where you were, to that linked item.

 

 

*Expected:*

Since I used the CTRL + Click command, it should be opened in a new tab, as that's the default behavior for web browsers.

Other links within Jira work properly with the CTRL + Click, but not the linked items on a Jira card.

 

 

I haven't tried this on Mac, whose equivalent would be COMMAND + Click.
fields.summary: Control + Click should open link in a new tab (web browser's default behavior)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13334].
{panel}
h3. Summary

On the [Cumulative Flow Diagram |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram] adding quick filters, Columns, and Swimlanes extends the overall length of the *Refine Reports* report filter drop down modal and will push the apply and cancel buttons beyond the window, with no option to scroll down.
h3. Environment

Verified with:
 * Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple [quick filters |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Quick+Filters], [Columns |https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/jira-agile-tutorials/tutorial-adding-a-column-to-a-board], and [Swimlanes |https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-swimlanes] in the board configuration
 # on [Cumulative Flow Diagram |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram]
 # Select Refine Report dropdown

h3. Expected Results

Ability to scroll if the options exceed the available Space
h3. Actual Results

The *apply* and *Cancel* buttons are cut off along with any options that extend below the window:

!Screen Shot 2019-01-29 at 9.51.32.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This impacts users with smaller screens and Lower resolution settings the most, but also impacts anyone with complex boards using many columns, with multiple swimlanes and then use many quick filters to better organize the complex board.
h3. Workaround
 * Zoom out in the browser (then close and reopen "Refine Report" dropdown) until the apply option is visible and can be selected, or press *esc* to close the dialogue to cancel any setting changes
 * Type tab key to switch the selected filter so that you can click the *apply* or *cancel* buttons
fields.summary: Refine Filters Modal dialog hides buttons on Cumulative Flow report

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to select an epic on the Old Issue View using only the keyboard (arrows and "Enter") will display an error that the epic does not exists. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an issue without an epic link
# Press "."
# Type "epic link" and press "Enter"
# Start typing the name of the epic
# Use Arrows' keysboard to move down to desired epic
# Press Enter to accept desired epic (+Don't user the mouse+)

h3. Expected Results
Jira should be able to identify the epic

h3. Actual Results
Jira will display an error: 
{code}
Epic with key "test" does not exist
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Linking an Epic to an issue using keyboard will display an error that the epic doesn't exist

fields.description:
Improved ARJ plans are implicitly showing all dates in UTC. This may lead to confusion when integrating sprints from boards. Sprints start and end on certain dates and times configured with the timezone associated with their board.

Consider for example a board configured with UTC+10 having a start date set to 1/Jan 1AM. If an issue is assigned to this sprint or scheduled into it by the auto-scheduling function, the associated bar in the visual schedule will show it to start on 31/Dec.

This problem could be resolved by introducing a configurable plan timezone that would be used instead of UTC.
fields.summary: Introduce a configurable Timezone for improved Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Plans

fields.description:
In Advanced Roadmaps for Jira (ARJ) sprints end one day earlier than they actually do on the board.
As ARJ is designed to support plans spanning over months or even years its time scale is always in days. Moreover sprints of a single team are not allowed to overlap. The combination of these constraints may result in cases that are confusing as there might be discrepancies between sprint end dates visible on Boards and the Gantt chart bars and scheduled end dates in ARJ.

Consider for example a sprint ending on the 31/Dec 9AM.  At some point ARJ needs to decide if the 31/Dec is considered to be part of this sprint or not - not only for the lengths of bars in the schedule, but also for capacity based planning as it is used in auto-scheduling. In this particular case it seems obvious to let the sprint end on 30/Dec in ARJ. But what about a sprint ending at 3PM.
To avoid complications arising from hard cutoffs where the difference of a single minute on the planned sprint end dates can have a significant impact on the outcome of auto-scheduling it has been decided to always exclude the last day of the sprint. This seemed to be the right decision as the next sprint can then start on the day configured on the board and a two weeks sprint on the board actually has 14 days.

In order to resolve this problem ARJ would need to change it’s time granularity and take the time of the day into account.
fields.summary: Resolve Inconsistencies between Sprint End Dates of Boards and Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
When transitioning issues using the Smart Commits syntax, it's not possible to transition issues that have a screen associated with a transition, and within that transition, there's a field validator.

It would be helpful to support that functionality.
fields.summary: Allow Smart Commits to support screen with validators

fields.description:
Development panel doesn't refresh information when switching between linked issues

h3. Issue Summary
When having at least two issues linked, if there is any development information associated with one issue, when clicking on the linked issue, the development panel retains the other issue development data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two issues and link them;
 # Associate any development information with just one of the issues;
 # Open the issue with that dev related information;
 # Switch between the two by clicking on the linked issue tab on the issue view;

h3. Expected Results
When refreshing the linked issue information, it should reload its view with the correct dev information.

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, the information between one issue and another gets mixed up. So far this has been intermittent.

Short video recording exemplifying this behavior:
* [Example|https://share.getcloudapp.com/E0unGzPL]

h3. Workaround
Use the old view.
fields.summary: Development panel doesn't refresh information when switching between linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing the Backlog on a Jira Software project, if you right-click to an issue, you'll be able to see the "Delete" option even though you don't have such permission. 

(!) If the user does not have Delete Issue Permission, Jira *will prevent* the user from deleting the issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the Backlog
# Right-click over an issue on backlog

h3. Expected Results
If the user does not have permission, it should not appear the option "Delete"

h3. Actual Results
The "Delete" option appears even though you don't have this permission. 
 !image-2020-06-22-16-41-54-869.png|thumbnail! 

If the user does not have Delete Issue Permission, Jira will prevent the user from deleting the issue. 
 !image-2020-06-22-16-43-13-728.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Right clicking on issues on backlog display "Delete issue" for users without permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users can't filter for issues in the plan scope using custom fields on Advanced Roadmaps

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to filter for issues  in the scope using the custom fields added to the plan

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow user to filter for issues in the plan scope using a custom field

fields.description:
Currently, the quarterly view of the Advanced Roadmaps shows data for the next 3 months.

In some scenarios, companies use different quarterly schedule.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be to customize the quarterly view
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be to customize the quarterly view

fields.description: Still says "Coming Soon"
fields.summary: When is Linked Project going to be available on Edit Screens?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Auto-scheduler, unestimated issues under the parent causes it to propose incoherent dates that ignore the dependencies and creates conflict. This is also applicable when estimating with "0".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Task1, Task2 with 2 Subtasks and Task3
 # Add the dependencies with Task3 blocking Task2 and Task2 blocking Task1
 # Add an *Estimate* value to Task1, Task2 and Task3 (excluding the subtasks)
 # Add the start/end dates to each Task making sure that they do not clash

h3. Expected Results

When using the *Auto-schedule*, the scheduler is expected to provide new start/end dates taken into account the dependencies of the Tasks.

h3. Actual Results

The scheduler completely ignores the dependencies and schedule dates that create depedencyes conflict with lead time.

 !2020-07-24_16-46-16.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Workaround

All child issues found under the dependency issues must be estimated.
fields.summary: Unestimated child issues causes incoherent dependency scheduling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per summary, in the new issue view, the home (or pos 1) key on the keyboard does not work on the link issue text field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to link an issue in new JIRA issue view.
 # Try to use the home key to return to the cursor to the start of the text field.

h3. Expected Results

The cursor returns to the start of the text field.

h3. Actual Results

The home button does not work at all.

h3. Workaround

This only affects the new JIRA issue view. If you revert back to the old view the home button works. You can disable Atlassian Labs at https://<atlassian-domain-name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa . This will revert the view back to the old issue view.
fields.summary: Home button key on the keyboard does not work for the link issue text field cursor to the start

fields.description:
Hi,

Everytime that I merge some PR (Branch), automaticlly Jira change the approver (QA -> PO).

Obs: I don't know if this settings we can change in our side.
fields.summary: GIT Hub x Jira

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to be able to monitor the integration status between Jira and tools connected through DVCS (such as Bitbucket or Github) through the Jira UI, especially on cases where the sync process may be stuck. It is possible for the DVCS syncing process to get stuck without any errors being thrown in the log, as the sync itself is still trying to finish. Knowing the status of syncing would make it easier to determine if there is an error and where it is
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have more monitoring tools at the Jira UI to help monitor the integration between Jira and DVCS integrated tools

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Ctrl + F browser shortcut does not search for issue keys on board cards, the hyphen between the project key, and the issue number breaks the search.

Here is a test Kanban board with the card KT-1.
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-14 at 21.50.00.png|thumbnail! 
  
 If we press ctrl+f and search for KT, we will find the project key.
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-14 at 21.51.49.png|thumbnail!

If we press ctrl+f and search for 1, we will find the issue number.
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-14 at 21.52.01.png|thumbnail!

However, if we search for KT- or -1, the hyphen will break the search and we won't find the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban board.
 # Create a card inside the Kanban board.
 # Press ctrl+f.
 # Search for the project key, you will find the issue.
 # Search for the issue number, you will find the issue.
 # Search for the project key + hyphen, the search will break.
 # Search for hyphen + the issue number, the search will break.

h3. Expected Results
The browser shortcut Ctrl+F should be able to search and find an issue using the issue key information.
h3. Actual Results
The browser shortcut Ctrl+F does not support the hyphen on board cards, it breaks the search for issue keys.
h3. Workaround
Use the board search box to find the issue using the issue key.
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-14 at 22.16.50.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The browser shortcut Ctrl + F does not find issue keys on board cards.

fields.description:
h2. Actual Behavior:
 - In the Agile board configuration, Column management, I can select a column constraint from the following options:
 ## None
 ## Issue Count
 ## Issue Count, excluding sub-tasks

h2. Expected Behavior:
 - There should be fourth option "Only sub-tasks"

h2. Context

I want to restrict the number of open sub-tasks using the WIP limit.
fields.summary: WIP limit based on subtask count

fields.description:
As a project administrator

I want the ability to set the background color for a quick filter

So that my team has better visibility to manage work items

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Quick filters for a board and backlog have a background color attribute
 * When the background color is set, the filter buttons display with that color when selected and the same color with less transparency when unselected
 * When the background color is not set, the filter buttons display with the default white (unselected) and light-blue (selected) colors
 * Colors can be selected from a palette or by name, such as defined epic color names
 * Quick filter colors have no impact upon card colors or WIP limit violation colors on the board
 * Multiple quick filters can have the same color, as they do today
fields.summary: Add ability to color code Quick Filters for a board

fields.description:
As of now , if a Jira-admin/roadmap user is not granted Edit permission on a Plan level , this restriction cannot be changed by the jira-admin/roadmap admin users. 
h3. Steps to replicate:
 * Log in as a *Trusted* user , who is not a Jira-administrator, and does not have Administrative permission for Advanced roadmaps.
 * Now with this Truster user , set the Access control ->Permission for editing to this user alone.
 * Switch back to your account ( who has permission to administer Jira /Advanced roadmaps).
 * The Plan which was restricted for Editing will be Read-only for you. Jira-admins/roadmap admins cannot change the Access control Permission.

h4. Suggestion:

It would be good if the roadmap admins can change the restrictions set on Plan level by other admins or users. This is somewhat similar to Private plans not being accessible to Jira admins , https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-20187.
fields.summary: Allow Jira admins/Roadmap admins to change the Edit permission on Plan level access permission

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I have come across a customer case where Epicname of all the EPICs and linked issues 
 (epic-links) are same after migration from nextgen to Classic project. However, the linking works fine.

!image-2020-07-23-13-54-49-763.png|width=147,height=50!

Also, Epic-panel shows the same Epicname for all Epics:
!image-2020-07-23-14-00-52-720.png|width=133,height=383!

 

Steps to Reproduce:

 1. JQL for EPICs from Nextgen Project
 2. Bulk move from Nextgen to Classic project
 3. Enter EpicName and other information
 4. Submit and Acknowledge
fields.summary: Epicname remains same across all the Epics and linked issues if bulk-operation is performed from Next-Gen to classic

fields.description:
This is currently included in Next-gen projects but not in classics.

When a board has several columns the content is narrowed to the point that it is difficult to see it, if the boards could have always the same size and a scroll bar appears to move left or right could be very helpful.

The only way to see the columns wider is by zooming out the browser.

-- Narrow columns in classic boards
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

-- Scroll bar from Next-gen projects
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Include a scroll bar to move left or right in classic project boards when there are several columns
As a Scrum Master, I'd like the ability to automatically start and stop sprints based on the dates I've entered.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Agile [Get projects|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/api-group-board/#api-agile-1-0-board-boardid-project-get] REST API not returning correct Project count if the filter is updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter with two projects in it.
{code}
project in (PA, PB) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
# Create a classic Scrum / Kanban board using the above filter.
# Take the board ID and run Get projects REST API using the board id.
{code}
https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/project' 
{code}
# The REST API call returns two projects as expected.
# Now, edit the filter and add one more project to the JQL, and save the changes.
{code}
project in (PA, PB, PC) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}
# Run the REST call on the same board.

h3. Expected Results
The REST call returns 3 projects after updating the filter.

h3. Actual Results
REST call still returns 2 projects.

h3. Additional Notes
Noticed the same behaviour when deleting one or more projects from existing filter.
{code}
project in (PA) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

h3. Workaround
Create a new filter by adding / moving the projects to the original JQL, and use it in the board.
fields.summary: Agile Get projects REST API not returning correct Project count if the filter is updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when required field is set for a project and users tries to create issues in a plan, the user will be prompted to re-insert the values of the required field while creating the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the Field Configuration used by the project included in the Advanced Roadmaps plan.
 # Set a field as required (Eg: Components).
 # Open Advanced Roadmaps plan.
 # Add the field which is set as required to the scope view.
 # Create a new issue on the plan.
 # Create a new child issue under the plan.
 # Set the required field for both of the issues.
 # Commit the changes.

h3. Expected Results

Both of the issues are created.
h3. Actual Results

User is required to fill in the detail for the required field again.
h3. Workaround

Enter the required field from the screen shown by dialog and commit the change.
fields.summary: Creating issues asks for required field when data is already provided

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This behavior only occurs when we create the ticket through the roadmaps view. If we use the top bar button "Create" it will not set the Resolved date field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to any nextgen project in our Jira cloud instance
2. Go to the Roadmap page
3. Create an issue from the roadmap view (+ create epic)
4. Notice the "resolutiondate" field has been set automatically

h3. Expected Results

No Resolution Date automatically set when the issue is created
h3. Actual Results

The "resolutiondate" field is set after issue creation.
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a ticket through the roadmaps view, it automatically sets the Resolved date field.

fields.description:
The next-gen project type includes the following hierarchy of issue types:

- Epic
- Story/Bug/Task/ other custom issue types
- Sub-task

The Roadmaps feature shows 2 levels of this hierarchy: Epics and Story/Bug/Task/ other custom issue types.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to add other hierarchy levels, like Initiatives and Themes (above Epic) and display it in Roadmaps
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to configure the issue type hierarchy in next-gen Roadmaps

fields.description:
In next-gen roadmaps, users can link issues by dragging-and-dropping.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want t to be able to link issues by dragging-and-dropping, like in the next-gen roadmap.

Also, when linking issues, the scroll of the page is disabled and I'd like to be able to scroll the page while linking issues
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want t to be able to link issues by dragging-and-dropping

fields.description:
Currently, every time you click the "Auto-schedule" button, in-progress issues are re-scheduled and the start and end dates are updated.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to have a way to keep (or enforce) the original start and/or end dates when hitting the auto-schedule button.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to enforce the start date and/or end date of the issues

fields.description:
Currently, if you have a start date and add estimation to an issue, the end date is set only when you hit the "Auto-schedule" button.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the end date to be automatically included when the estimation is set.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the end date to be automatically included when the estimation is set

fields.description: At this time the only way to get the date of project creation is through the database, please display this value for all projects.
fields.summary: Display Project creation date

fields.description:
Currently, the View settings drop-down menu in plans allow users to customize how data is displayed. Users can group issues into separate swimlanes like: assignees and projects, components, teams, sprints, releases and labels.

It would be nice if users could set custom fields for this as well.
fields.summary: Allow admins to customize the Group By option from View Settings menu

fields.description: Project Admins need the ability to define their own Issue Types, Status types, and Workflows. It is cumbersome to go through the site Jira Admin to create these things.
fields.summary: Project Admins need more customization options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced Roadmaps auto-schedule does not make the calculated values of sub-tasks persistent
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Advanced Roadmaps plan which contains sub-tasks
 # Click auto-schedule

h3. Expected Results
 * The auto-scheduler will work out the empty values and save the results

h3. Actual Results
 * The auto-scheduler works out the empty values in the sub-tasks and displays but does not save them

h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps auto-schedule does not make the calculated values of sub-tasks persistent

fields.description: In the Control Chart (https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/view-and-understand-the-control-chart/), it would be great to be able to see here the number of triggered transitions between the different states as well.
fields.summary: Add number of triggered transitions between the different states to Control Chart

fields.description:
A customer wants the preview of their pictures attached files to be shown on their Classic Kanban Board as they are shown on Next-Gen Boards:

!Screen Shot 2020-07-20 at 16.40.22.png|width=643,height=636!
fields.summary: Thumbnails of attachments from Issues on Classic Kanban Boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new issue view, when users have an Active Sprint running, they will see a duplicated value for it when using the new issue view. This causes misleading information like a possible database inconsistency or which value they should select.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the new issue view
# Start a Sprint
# Open the select list from Sprint field

New issue view:
 !new view.png|thumbnail! 
Old issue view:
 !old view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Only one sprint value will appears as there is no duplicate entry in the database.

h3. Actual Results
Users see duplicate values

h3. Workaround
Deactivate the new issue view.
fields.summary: On the new issue view, sprint field shows duplicated values

fields.description:
On the web version, it's not possible to display in the backlog issues that are on blue statuses mapped on the last column of the board. However, the mac app is showing those issues.

It would be awesome to fix those inconsistencies because it's affecting some customers that are using the app version or/and comparing it with the web version.

h3. workaround
Map the blue statuses to another column of the board rather than the last column
fields.summary: Backlog Inconsistency regarding statuses with mac app

fields.description: As of now , when we group by colours , especially "Colour by Status" ,under view settings in Advanced roadmaps , the colors are very dark and it can be hard to distinguish. It would be great if we can incorporate *textures* when grouping by colours.
fields.summary: Add textures to Advanced roadmaps timelines when grouped by colors under View settings.

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
 While both filter and group-by options are applied for the *Team* field, no issues are displayed.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Select a team in the project filter.
 # Now in the view settings, select group by teams

*Expected Results*
 Issues should be grouped by teams.

*Actual Results*
 Shows an empty list of issues.

*Workaround*
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Group by Team while Team filter is applied shows empty list of issues

fields.description:
The documentation [Displaying the dependencies map|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapsserver/displaying-the-dependencies-map-1005805794.html] describes the possibility to map dependencies in the Advanced Roadmaps for Jira Server.

As a Jira Software Premium user, I want to have the same feature in Jira Software Cloud.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software Premium user, I want to see the dependencies map in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inconsistent error is being returned when the sprint end date value is 20 years or more apart from the sprint start date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sprint and start the sprint.
 # At the sprint end date field, key in a date value that is 20 years apart from the sprint start date value.

h3. Expected Results

Incorrect / misleading error message is displayed.

 !image-2020-07-17-23-33-48-852.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

This error message should be shown instead.

 !image-2020-07-17-23-32-50-745.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround for this as of now.
fields.summary: Misleading error message for large date values in sprint end date field

fields.description:
The maximum size for a cross-functional team is 8-12. As it is only the avatars of *six* users are shown immediately, the rest are hidden under the "+" icon. This is quite annoying for the team as it means extra clicking, but there is also a feeling that Jira is treating some team members differently. In other words, not a good user experience.

My suggestion is to allow up to 12 avatars be shown be default at the top of the Kanban board before employing the "+" icon. There is plenty of space there. Alternatively, make the number of avatars shown configurable.
fields.summary: Allow more avatars on Kanban board

fields.description:
Customer wanted to restrict users from linking or deleting the links from the issue in a specific "status". They use the below Jira property to achieve the same
{code:java}
jira.permission.link.denied with a Null value{code}
In the Old issue view, the option to delete is not available for the linked issues. However, in the new issue view, they are still able to delete the linked issues in the ticket.

*Expected result:*

Should not be able to delete the linked options on using the above property even in the new issue view.

*Actual result:*

Able to delete the linked issues in new issue view.
fields.summary: Unable to restrict user from deleting links in new issue view using property

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users who are currently on Live plans view , when they click on three dots (...) and click on "Try the improved interface" nothing happens
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Try the improved interface"
 

h3. Expected Results
Should navigate to improved interface
h3. Actual Results
Currently nothing happens


h3. Workaround
* Click on "Configure" 
* Then click on "Enable improved interface" . ( Refer screenshots).
fields.summary: Clicking on "Try the improved interface" for advanced roadmaps does not do anything.

fields.description: The Jira Software REST API doesn't allow the columns of a board to be specified when creating a board. It also doesn't allow the columns of an existing board to be updated/modified. It is suggested that the API be expanded to include these features.
fields.summary: Add the ability to define board configuration through the REST API

fields.description:
h2. Problem:

When trying to copy colored formatted text from a document in Microsoft Word or Google Docs, for example, and pasting into any field (Comment or Description, for example), the colored text is not copied properly, but the bold formatted or bulleted text is.

h2. Example:

Copied text from Google Docs:

!Screen Shot 2017-07-21 at 3.41.29 PM.png|width=292,height=53!

Pasted text from Google Docs to JIRA:

!Screen Shot 2017-07-21 at 3.42.00 PM.png|width=424,height=159!
h2. Cause

A Word document is not HTML or RTF. It's a proprietary, binary file format. When you copy to the clipboard the information is converted to HTML or RTF, but the result might not be what you expect. 

h2. Suggestion

Make the JIRA Rich Text Editor plugin (WYSIWYG) copy and paste properly all the formatted content from a Microsoft Word, Pages (Mac OS) and Google Docs document,  This is possible with GitHub issues.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG Editor flaws when trying to copy formatted text from Microsoft Word or Google Docs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Next-gen Board - mini-map is broken after sidebar collapse
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open next-gen board
 # collapse sidebar
 # minimap is broken

[^mini-map-issue.mov]
h3. Expected Results

Minimap works after the sidebar collapse
h3. Actual Results

Minimap is broken
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Next-gen Board - mini-map is broken after sidebar collapse

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there is no possibility to restrict users from adding issues to Active Sprints. A user has permission to add issues to Sprint if they have:
 * Schedule Issues permission and
 * Edit Issues permission

This means they can rank issues in the Backlog and Add issues to Sprints (Future and Active).
h3. Suggested Solution

Add restriction so only some users can Add issues to a Sprint that is Active. And keep the Schedule permission for open Sprints. 
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Permission to Add Issues to only open Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the Cloud Version of Advanced Roadmaps there is only a share option avaliable in the new interface and no export option as detailed in the cloud documentation ["Sharing roadmaps"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/sharing-roadmaps-998651329.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
Looking to add in an export to CSV option in Advanced Roadmaps Cloud to align with the  Export a plan to CSV feature released to the server version in [3.23 | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolio/portfolio-for-jira-3-23-release-notes-998639939.html#PortfolioforJira3.23releasenotes-export-plan-to-csv] and detailed in the Server Documentation ["Sharing and exporting plan data"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/sharing-and-exporting-plan-data-998886665.html] 
 
h3. Workaround
Using the new planning interface there is no option to export at this time, you will need to switch to the Live plan interface for an export option as covered in ["Exporting reports to CSV"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/exporting-reports-to-csv-998651780.html].  To switch the plan interface go to "Plan Configuration" >> "Planning interface" and select  the "Disable improved interface" option to switch back to the [live plan view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1003524902]
fields.summary: Include a Export to CSV option to Advanced Roadmaps cloud

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Currently, when using the Release functionality in a Software project, and having integration with Bamboo, only the most recent 5 builds are available on the release panel. 

h4. Suggestion
Allow the user to:
* Choose a branch;
* Choose a build

Before releasing a version in a Software project.
fields.summary: Allow the "Release - with existing build" functionality to return more builds from Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira is able to remember the previous search made in "issue search" in the project causing issues with "NOT IN"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter with Basic search.
 # Create another filter with JQL query which is simple.
 # Browse to any other options in Jira like may be Dashboard or anything in Jira.
 # Now, select one of the saved filter, say the first filter with "Basic search".
 # Select the second filter which was saved using "JQL", still, the search will be showing as "Basic" and will not be switched to JQL even though it was saved as JQL(as the query is simple).
 # If you choose to open the JQL filter first, then if you open the other search with "basic" type, then you will see that filter search will still remain as "JQL"
 # Due to this, if you are having any filter saved with "NOT IN", they get dropped on clicking "search" button. Refer video attached for the same.

h3. Expected Results

Customer should be able to see the same search which was used when saving them. 
h3. Actual Results

Whichever type of search was opened first, Jira remembers and displays the rest of the saved filters in the same search type.
h3. Workaround

Do not click on "search" when you are simply switching between saved filters of type "basic" and "JQL"
fields.summary: Jira remembers previous/last "issue search"type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some content might be unavailable under some circumstances because of not having the best code practices. The results were thrown by axe-core chrome extension. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Steps to reproduce (on Chrome):
 Make sure axe extension is installed on Chrome:
 [https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/axe-web-accessibility-tes/lhdoppojpmngadmnindnejefpokejbdd?hl=en-US]
 # Access a site and run the check:

h3. Expected Results

Nothing should have conflicts.
h3. Actual Results

The auditor reports issues in the majority on this element: atlassian-navigation--header
 Some of the issues come from this frame element: com.chegg.prodtutorsclient_tutors-client-prod_142c5656
 !image-2020-07-14-18-05-05-377.png! 
 !image-2020-07-14-18-05-58-721.png! 
 !image-2020-07-14-18-06-24-753.png!
h3. Workaround

No workaround, any feature apparently affected.
fields.summary: Jira front-end elements accessibility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's not possible to access some Next-Gen project's board.

h3. Expected Results

When having the needed permissions, the user should be able to access the board.
h3. Actual Results

A "something's going wrong message" is shown:

!image-2020-07-14-12-46-55-981.png|width=313,height=118!

Got a 404 response when try reloading the page:

{code}{"errors":{},"errorMessages":["The property navigation_next_ui_state does not exist."],"httpStatusCode":{"present":true}}{code}

h3. Workaround

Contact the Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Not able to access Next-Gen project's board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The version report gadget loads indefinitely. Based on the version closed issues story points and in the story points from the open issues at the version JIRA calculates that the version will take longer than 20 years to be closed, therefore, the gadget won't load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and estimate some issues
# Close some of the estimated issues
# Create a release and include the closed issues
# Create a dashboard and add the version report gadget referencing the created release

(i) Make sure the closed issues have a smaller estimate than the open ones. The idea here is to make the release velocity low based on the closed issues so the open ones make the estimation bigger.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget will load as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The version report gadget loads infinitely and the following error is logged in the browser logs:
{code}
Request URL: https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/workingdays/rates?rapidViewId=4&startDate=1587258000000&endDate=2718850719147&_=1594332289146
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 400 
Response:
{"errorMessages":["End date is more than 20 years away"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Workaround

Change the Release start date to a later date or re-estimate the issues to make the release velocity higher.
fields.summary: Version report gadgets loads indefinitely

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After doing a site rename, the Github Configuration page becomes unavailable and you're unable to manage your organizations.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a site rename on an instance
 # Go to *Manage apps* and open the "get started" for the Github add-on

h3. Expected Results

You should be directed to the Github Configuration page where you can manage your organizations.

 !GitHub_Configuration_-_tet.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

You will be directed to the Github configuration page but the page cannot load.

 !GitHub_Configuration_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Uninstall and re-install the Github add-on from the *Find new apps*.
fields.summary: After a site rename Github configuration becomes unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Wrong Padding on Board Issue Detail View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any kanban or scrum board.
 # Click on an Issue to open the details on the right part of the screen.
 

h3. Expected Results

The text padding should be better.


h3. Actual Results
 !Capture.PNG|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround


Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Board old issue details view layout with wrong padding

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to start the sprint in Scrum project when the profile language is set as Russian as it suggests wrong End date and the end date is in English

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the language in your Atlassian account to Russian (русский)
# Try to Start a sprint from the backlog of the scrum project
# Click on Start Sprint
# Change the sprint duration and look at the end date

h3. Expected Results
The Sprint end date is calculated based on the 1-4 week duration you choose Or you are able to choose the date from the calendar in the Russian language
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The month is written in English
* The incorrect end date is calculated
* You cannot choose the month manually
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!   !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!   !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Switch the language to English. Or Reach out to Atlassian support
fields.summary: Unable to start sprint in Scrum project when the profile language is set as Russian

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
Currently, the sub-tasks, that are below a Story, estimations are not reflected in the report.

h4. Suggested Solution
On Epic Burndown calculation, consider the sub-tasks estimation similar to what the "Burndown chart" does.
fields.summary: Include the sub-task estimation on the "Epic burndown" report

fields.description: Today, attachments can be displayed only in the top part of Next-gen Board cards. It would be useful if they could be placed at the bottom of the card, below the issue-key and other issue details.
fields.summary: Ability to select where attachments are displayed on the Board card

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Save As" button available while editing a saved filter is misleading. If no changes are made to the filter or if the filter columns are modified, user tends to click on the "Save As" button to save the changes. Upon doing so, the following message is prompted on-screen even if the user owns filter:
{code:java}
This filter was created by <user name>. You can save a copy of this filter but you cannot modify the original.{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Open a saved filter
 _Filters > View all filters > Click on a saved filter_

 2) Click on "*Save As*" button
h3. Expected Results

Replace the "Save As" button to either "Clone Filter" or "Duplicate filter" button. The message prompted on the screen should also be modified as the owner of the filter is prompted that the original filter cannot be modified.
h3. Actual Results

Clicking "Save As" button without making any changes or making changes to filter columns displays the following message even if the user owns of the filter:
{code:java}
This filter was created by <user name>. You can save a copy of this filter but you cannot modify the original.{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: UI Enhancement: "Save As" button while editing a saved filter is misleading

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of August 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this ticket.

We understand that closing an issue as ‘Done’ can sometimes be a misnomer, e.g. the issue was a duplicate, or deprioritised as ‘won’t do', or has become obsolete. 

As this ticket is a duplicate of [JSWCLOUD-18435|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-18435], we are closing this ticket so that we can aggregate the feedback on a single ticket. 

Cheers,
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}

An option to close a ticket as 'Canceled' or 'Won't Do' would be really helpful as sometimes there are tickets that have useful details and shouldn't be permanently deleted or left in the Backlog indefinitely.
fields.summary: Canceled or Won't Do option for next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When changing the order of columns, there is no place to identify those changes.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add logs of the changes in the audit log.
fields.summary: Add to the audit log when column orders change in a next-gen project

fields.description:
The number of days between start and end dates is based on calendar days, not working days.

It'd be good to an option to calculate only working days ignoring weekends and/or public holidays set in the calendar configuration.
fields.summary: Number of days between start and end dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logging work in the New Issue View, the *Start Date* field is automatically set to (local time - work logged). In the issue history, the logged work action is displayed as (local time - work logged) causing it to no be displayed in the Burndown Chart.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# An issue is worked and then added to the Active Sprint;
# The work is logged in the issue;
# If using the new issue view, the logged work won't reflect in the Burndown Chart;
# On the old issue view, it will correctly reflect.

New issue view:   [^Screen Recording 2020-07-06 at 11.13 AM.mp4] 
Old Issue view: [^Screen Recording 2020-07-06 at 11.14 AM.mp4] 

!Image 2020-07-06 at 11.15.43 AM.png|thumbnail! 
In this example, the work was logged twice, one in the new issue view and one in the old. We can see that only the second is logged.

h3. Expected Results

The logged work is displayed in the Burndown Chart.

h3. Actual Results

Logged work in the new issue view does not reflect in the Burndown Chart.

h3. Workaround

Log work in the old issue view.
fields.summary: Log Work "Start Date" in the New Issue View do not reflect on Burndown Chart

fields.description: Currently, editing the group access via REST API is not possible. Looking forward for any such development.
fields.summary: Edit group access via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When _jira.permission.scheduleissue.denied_ property is set to one status in the workflow, it blocks the possibility to reorder issues (“rank”) on the board and backlog as also the possibility to edit Due Date field. However, we are able to move the issue to an Active Sprint although Jira shows the following error:

!image-2020-07-07-19-30-46-968.png|width=375,height=95!

This error is the same that is shown when reordering issues in the Backlog. However, for this action, the property indeed blocks the action, making the issue return to its original place.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Apply _jira.permission.scheduleissue.denied_ (property key) / _true_ (property value) to a specific status in the workflow
 # Go to the project backlog
 # Drag and drop to the active sprint an issue which current status is the one to which property above was applied
 # The error message will appear (_"You do not have permission to rank..."_) but the issue will stay in the Active Sprint
 # If you refresh the page, nothing changes

h3. Expected Results

The error message should not be shown since the issue is added to the Sprint.
h3. Actual Results

An error message related to the Schedule Issue permission is shown even though the issue is added to the Active Sprint.
h3. Workaround

It's possible to build an Automation rule to, whenever Sprint field is updated, if the issue is on the specific status, clear the Sprint field. However, this action is done silently and the user may not notice the issue was not added to the Sprint since no error message will be shown.
fields.summary: The jira.permission.scheduleissue.denied property shows wrong error message when adding issue to Active Sprint

fields.description: At present, the multi-selection list is not available in next-gen projects made available in Jira Cloud. This custom field type was previously available in classic, and should be included as part of the next-gen offering.
fields.summary: Multi-Selection List in Next-Gen Jira Cloud Projects

fields.description:
When using Next-Gen projects, I would like to be able to pin epics panel opened and keep it opened on backlog view.


I have to manually open it everytime I have to look at my backlog and filter by epics.
fields.summary: Ability to pin epics panel opened on backlog view - Next-gen project

fields.description:
In the recent versions of Advanced Roadmaps to Jira Server,  the velocity is possible to be set at the Sprint level.

As an Advanced Roadmap for Jira Cloud user, I want to be able to do the same.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmap user, I want it to allow the velocity to be set at the sprint level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the feature group by Epic in a next-gen board the results are inconsistent, it seems that when Sprints are active the Epics displayed are only the ones with child issues associated with the active sprint.

When the Sprints feature is off the results are inconsistent, the issues displayed previously when the Sprint feature was on are kept.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn Off the Sprints feature
 # In the board select group by Epics
 [^Group By Epic BUG.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
All the Epics with child issues from the roadmap are displayed in a swimlane view in the Board

h3. Actual Results
Inconsisten results that varies from the Epics previously associated with the active sprint to no Epics displayed on the board are displayed.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Group By Epic feature not working in a Next-gen board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pie chart gadget sends header limit error when the filter calls around 430 issues.
When clicking on any segment of the pay chart Jira sends all the called issues through the URL, if these are more that 430 the user receives a "header too large error"

Problem is reported for other gadgets as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter with a JQL like issue in (ISS-1,ISS-2,ISS3,ISS-4...........) with more than 430 issues
 # Create a workload pie chart gadget and use the previously created filter
 # Click on a segment of the pie chart
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
To display the information or one error indicating what is the problem

h3. Actual Results
A 400 bad request header too large error is displayed

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

In case that search does not work, it is possible to try a different approach:
* Create a new filter and refer to the existing filter. e.g filter_new = <filter used in the dashboard>
* Change the gadget to use the new filter. 400 error should be resolve in most of the case
fields.summary: Any gadget sends header limit error when the filter calls around 430 issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for the "Parent Link" field using "IS NOT EMPTY" returns inconsistent results
h3. Steps to Reproduce

We can see extra results with JQL queries related to Parent Links (Image 2020-07-06 at 11.12.07 PM.png)

The unexpected result with this query (Image 2020-07-06 at 11.11.54 PM.png)

 
h3. Expected Results

The search should only return issues that have a value for the Parent Link field.

h3. Actual Results

The search return issues without a value for the Parent Link field.
When using the "IS EMPTY" operator the search result excludes issues that don't have a value for the Parent Link and should appear.

h3. Workaround

Only via JQL search is not possible right now.
fields.summary: Searching for the "Parent Link" field using "IS NOT EMPTY" returns inconsistent results

fields.description:
As an PO I want to be able to assign multiple advanced roadmap shared teams to one issue.

We have multiple teams that are filling a supporting role one more than one issues (e.g. Initiatives, Epics) These teams are required to fore-fill certain actions for these issues.

I don't want to create a plan based team for every plan we need this team to be working on a this won't give us an overview were the team is working on. 

So the option to use shared teams fits the requirement, but we want to be able to assign more than *one* shared team to an issue
fields.summary: Assign multiple shared teams to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users add status in Card Layout configuration of Backlog view, it shows in 2 lines.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to board settings > Card layout
 # On Backlog add "Status" 
 # Go back to the backlog and status will display on a second line

h3. Expected Results
Status be displayed on the side of the summary avoiding to display 2 lines on the cards

h3. Actual Results
The status will be displayed under the summary making a bigger backlog view

h3. Workaround
No workaround available
fields.summary: Display Card Layout additional field in 1 line in Backlog View

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

Currently, as there isn't the concept of permission scheme in Team managed projects, there's no way of bulk editing projects access at once.
h3. *Suggestion:*

Add a way for bulk changing multiple Team managed projects' access.

This comes handy when there are way too many Team managed projects created as it would be much easier to manage them and accomplish changes to them.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk change Team managed projects access (Private, Limited, Open)

fields.description:
The customer need a feature that allows blocking some words so the users are not able to use them, maybe have a way to create a list of blocked words for example.

This could be useful when the customer wants to restrict some words and use them for search for example.
fields.summary: Ability to block specific words from being used

fields.description:
Hi, 

I'm using Jira to report out on issues that I'm doing "today" and I would like to be able to manually sort the issues into the order that I'm planning on doing them that day. These issues span multiple products. What I'd like is to be able to have a grabber handle on each issue that allows me to move the issues up and down in the list of issues.  !image-2020-07-05-20-34-46-099.png!
fields.summary: Allow for manual sorting of issues in dashboard filter results gadget

fields.description:
After assigning a child issue on a next-gen project, the assignee avatar icon is displayed but after refreshing the page it is missed.

See below a video:

 [^ffAssigneeNextG.mp4] 

It would be awesome if the icon wasn't lost.
fields.summary: Missing assignee avatar icon on child issues - Next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if users set a longer name for Sprint, part of the Sprint Name will be hidden in Sprint picker field in pages like Sprint Report:

 !Sprint Name.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution

Customer would like either:

# The Sprint picker field width is increased or
# Give admin option to configure the width of the field


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: increase width of Sprint picker field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to access Jira Software Sprint health and Sprint Burndown gadgets from a Jira Server/Datacenter instance, the gadgets will fail to load with the gadget URL being blocked by CORS policy. As the CORS policy must be set on the server, this issue would require changes to the policy set for the impacted gadgets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Confluence Server so that it can be accessed over the internet.
 # Add Application link back to Jira Software Cloud instance
 # Add the gadget feed to point to the Jira instance in Confluence
 # Wait long enough for the feed to pull in the gadgets
 # Attempt to use the sprint burndown gadget

h3. Expected Results

The gadget loads and functions normally

h3. Actual Results

The Gadget will be blocked by CORS, you will see many errors in the Javascript console regarding functions missing. Here are some examples:

{noformat}
TypeError: AJS.$._OriginalDeferred is not a function
    at Function.AJS.$.Deferred (batch.js?locale=en-US:10232)
    at RequireHandler.require (batch.js?locale=en-US:4881)
    at Object.WRM.require (batch.js?locale=en-US:129)
    at n (batch.js?locale=en-US:144)
    at batch.js?locale=en-US:144
{noformat}
{noformat}
Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidview' from origin 'http://confluence.jaredlongtest.com' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.
{noformat}
=== Example HAR ===
 [^confluence.jaredlongtest.com.har] 
=== Example Javascript Console ===
 [^confluence.jaredlongtest.com-1593729482888-JS_console.log] 
===


h3. Workaround

There is currently no known workaround
fields.summary: Accessing Sprint Burndown and Sprint Health Gadgets in Confluence server Blocked by CORS

fields.description:
As described in the documentation [Adding target dates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/adding-target-dates-998651513.html], the live plans (or the old version of Portfolio) allows users to baseline a plan against target dates, and this feature isn't present in Advanced Roadmaps.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be able to baseline a plan against target dates
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be able to baseline a plan against target dates

fields.description:
We'd like to have a tab added to the Your Work page so that it would list all items pending your approval.  Would like to have that tab use a jql query to list the current user pending approval list.

Currently this screen only has the following tabs:
*Worked on*
*Viewed*
*Assigned to me*
*Starred*
 
 **
fields.summary: Ability to add "Needs Approval" as a tab to the "Your Work" page

fields.description:
Regarding the horizontal list of user icons at the top of the Sprint page and Backlog page:

As a developer, it would be helpful if this list would expand with the window.  As it is, several people on our team are always stuck under the "+" button instead of being visible.  There is lots of room on that horizontal bar to show everyone when we have the window expanded.
fields.summary: Let user icon list expand when the window is large enough
